summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 discussing the technical processing and transfer of hard drives containing productions (likely evidence) for the case US v. Epstein. The correspondence involves coordination between legal or technical personnel regarding the stamping, exporting, and delivery of data from a Relativity database.

events.title: Potential Production Deadline
events.description: Mentioned as a date for which an extension from Judge Nathan is being planned, related to the completion of document stamping and export.

keyFacts: Email chain concerns the technical processing of evidence (productions 15 & 16) for US v. Epstein onto hard drives.
A vendor is stamping and exporting data from a Relativity database in multiple parts (at least seven parts mentioned).
The data includes files from the USAO-SDFL (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida) loaded into another Epstein database.
The correspondence indicates planning to request an extension from Judge Nathan, but progress appears faster than the discussed November 19th date.
